panels.description: The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission.  Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams.
panels.title: Tx Datagram Requests / minute

panels.description: The number of output IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).  Note that this counter would include datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.
panels.title: Tx Datagram Discards / minute

panels.description: The number of IP datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination.  Note that this counter includes any packets counted in ipForwDatagrams which meet this `no-route' criterion.  Note that this includes any datagarms which a host cannot route because all of its default gateways are down.
panels.title: Tx Datagrams without Routes / minute

panels.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.
panels.title: Rx Datagrams Received / minute

panels.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user-protocols (including ICMP).
panels.title: Rx Datagram Deliveries / minute

panels.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.  This count includes invalid addresses (e.g., 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported Classes (e.g., Class E).  For entities which are not IP Gateways and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.
panels.title: Rx IP Address Errors / minute

panels.description: The number of locally-addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
panels.title: Rx Datagrams with Unknown Protocols / minute

panels.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
panels.title: Rx Header Errors / minute

panels.description: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).  Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting re-assembly.
panels.title: Rx Datagram Discards / minute

panels.description: The number of IP datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at this entity.
panels.title: Fragments Created / minute

panels.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at this entity.
panels.title: Fragmentations Successful / minute

panels.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this entity but could not be, e.g., because their Don't Fragment flag was set.
panels.title: Fragmentation Failures / minute

panels.description: The number of IP fragments received which needed to be reassembled at this entity.
panels.title: Reassembly Requests / minute

panels.description: The number of IP datagrams successfully re-assembled.
panels.title: Reassembly Successes / minute

panels.description: The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc).  Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IP fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received.
panels.title: Reassembly Failures / minute

panels.description: The total number of segments received, including those received in error.  This count includes segments received on currently established connections.
panels.title: Rx Segments / minute

panels.description: The total number of segments received in error (e.g., bad TCP checksums).
panels.title: Rx Errors / minute

panels.description: The total number of segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets.
panels.title: Tx Segments / minute

panels.description: The number of TCP segments sent containing the RST flag.
panels.title: Tx Resets / minute

panels.description: The total number of segments retransmitted - that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets.
panels.title: Retransmitted Segments / minute

panels.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-SENT state from the CLOSED state.
panels.title: Active Opens / minute

panels.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the ESTABLISHED state or the CLOSE-WAIT state.
panels.title: Established Resets / minute

panels.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the SYN-RCVD state from the LISTEN state.
panels.title: Passive Opens / minute

panels.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SYN-SENT state or the SYN-RCVD state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the LISTEN state from the SYN-RCVD state.
panels.title: Attempt Fails / minute

panels.description: The total number of UDP datagrams delivered to UDP users.
panels.title: Rx Datagrams / minute

panels.description: The total number of UDP datagrams sent from this entity.
panels.title: Tx Datagrams / minute

panels.description: The total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.
panels.title: Rx without Port / minute

panels.description: The total number of received UDP datagrams for which there was no application at the destination port.
panels.title: Rx Errors / minute
